text: when I became Prime Minister last July I
felt that the most important thing was
stability for the country we'd had the
referendum which had come out with the
result in terms of voting to leave the
EU that hadn't been expected obviously
David Cameron had resigned I'd taken
over as Conservative Party leader and
Prime Minister and I thought it was
important to have a period of stability
at that stage and to ensure that the
British people could have confidence
that their government was going to
deliver on what they voted for which was
leaving the European Union and so
getting through that process of the
early work of preparation for and then
triggering article 50 was very important
when it came to triggering article 50
around that time it became clear the
extent to which the opposition parties
in Westminster were intent on what I
would describe as frustrating the brexit
process because brexit isn't just about
the letter that says we want to leave
it's about negotiating the deal it's
about getting the right deal from Europe
and you know when we've been told by the
Liberal Democrats they want to grind
Parliament the government to its
standstill labor threatened to vote
against the deal the SNP the Scottish
nationalists saying they would vote
against us legislating to leave the
European Union I felt it was important
that the country is united I think
there's a unity of purpose in your
country I'm your master
I mean you've changed your mind you said
something and you're now saying exactly
the opposite and let's be clear it is
only a matter of weeks ago that you said
in Scotland now is not the time you said
all our energies should be focused on
our negotiations with the European Union
everything you've just described you
knew when you said that yeah what we are
now going to be able to do I believe
with this election is actually
strengthen our position in terms of our
negotiations with the European Union I
know if I just come on to that I think
people have a unity of purpose the
public want us to actually deliver on
leaving the European Union and they want
us to build that stronger Britain for
the future beyond
leaving the European Union that's what
having an election now it gives us that
opportunity for stability
and certainty okay for that longer
period let me set all your reasons if I
may you blamed your opponents just now
you blame them yesterday just explain to
people how many times have you been
defeated in the House of Commons on
brexit we got the Lee article 50
legislation through not without not
narrow defeat no defeats in the house of
a majority for 384 so where are these
divisions in Westminster that are doing
you so much damage no let's just look at
the what has happened over the last nine
months or so Nick when we took article
50 legislation through is very clear and
we were able to say to people this was
delivering on the vote of the British
people in the referendum they wanted us
to trigger article 50 they wanted us to
get on with the job of putting brexit
into inter practice of actually leaving
the european union but what became clear
around that time was yes people voted in
the House of Commons to trigger that
process but they were intent on
frustrating the necessary things that we
have to do afterwards
